CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 21, 1958, pg. 1, reads: "Congratulations! Robert E. (Pappy) Williams, left: Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald, right, and Mrs. Mary Ellen Hodge, center, exchange congratulations after the Fifth Ward election Tuesday night at A. Leo Weil School. Mr. Williams was re-elected chairman;  Mrs. Hodge became the new vice chairman, and Alderman Fitzgerald was the choice for secretary. - Harris Photo."Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 11, 1964, pg. 3, reads: "In 1958 - Shown shortly after the Democratic ward election in June 1958 are (seated left to right) Mrs. Mary Ellen Hodge, vice chairman, and City Councilman Paul J. Jones, now deceased, and (standing left to right) Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald, Chairman "Pappy" Williams, Constable Thomas J. Smith and Atty. K. Leroy Irvis, now a State Assemblyman."
TitMainTitle: Mary Ellen Hodge and Paul F. Jones seated, with Harry Fitzgerald, Robert E. "Pappy" Williams, Thomas J. "Tommy" Smith, and K. Leroy Irvis standing, in auditorium of A. Leo Weil School
CatSubject_tab: Irvis, K. Leroy, 1919-Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Williams, Robert E.Group portraits--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Smith, Tommy.
